title: Graphical Models and Probabilistic Reasoning
description: Graphical models represent probabilistic relationships between variables using graphs, enabling efficient inference and learning in complex systems.
learning_objectives: Represent probabilistic relationships using directed and undirected graphs
Connect graphical models to Active Inference

content.overview: Graphical models provide a visual and computational framework for representing and reasoning about probabilistic relationships in complex systems. They make explicit the conditional independence relationships between variables, enabling efficient algorithms for inference and learning.
